region.description: If region is not set, then no region will be used and them you need expensify in every resource even if you expensify here you can overwrite in a resource.

token.description: This is the Civo API token. Alternatively, this can also be specified using `CIVO_TOKEN` environment variable.

account_id.description: The account ID of the domain

block.description: Provides a Civo DNS domain name resource.

account_id.description: The account ID of this resource

created_at.description: Timestamp when this resource was created

name.description: The portion before the domain name (e.g. www) or an @ for the apex/root domain (you cannot use an A record with an amex/root domain)

priority.description: Useful for MX records only, the priority mail should be attempted it (defaults to 10)

ttl.description: How long caching DNS servers should cache this record for, in seconds (the minimum is 600 and the default if unspecified is 600)

type.description: The choice of RR type from a, cname, mx or txt

updated_at.description: Timestamp when this resource was updated

value.description: The IP address (A or MX), hostname (CNAME or MX) or text value (TXT) to serve for this record

block.description: Provides a Civo DNS domain record resource.

network_id.description: The firewall network, if is not defined we use the default network

region.description: The firewall region, if is not defined we use the global defined in the provider

block.description: Provides a Civo firewall resource. This can be used to create, modify, and delete firewalls.

cidr.description: The CIDR notation of the other end to affect, or a valid network CIDR (e.g. 0.0.0.0/0 to open for everyone or 1.2.3.4/32 to open just for a specific IP address)

direction.description: Will this rule affect ingress traffic (only `ingress` is supported now)

end_port.description: The end of the port range (this is optional, by default it will only apply to the single port listed in start_port)

label.description: A string that will be the displayed name/reference for this rule

protocol.description: The protocol choice from `tcp`, `udp` or `icmp` (the default if unspecified is `tcp`)

start_port.description: The start of the port range to configure for this rule (or the single port if required)

block.description: Provides a Civo firewall rule resource. This can be used to create, modify, and delete firewalls rules. This resource don't have an update option because Civo backend doesn't support it at this moment. In that case, we use `ForceNew` for all object in the resource.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the instance was created

disk_image.description: The ID for the disk image to use to build the instance

firewall_id.description: The ID of the firewall to use, from the current list. If left blank or not sent, the default firewall will be used (open to all)

hostname.description: A fully qualified domain name that should be set as the instance's hostname

initial_user.description: The name of the initial user created on the server (optional; this will default to the template's default_username and fallback to civo)

network_id.description: This must be the ID of the network from the network listing (optional; default network used when not specified)

notes.description: Add some notes to the instance

region.description: The region for the instance, if not declare we use the region in declared in the provider

reverse_dns.description: A fully qualified domain name that should be used as the instance's IP's reverse DNS (optional, uses the hostname if unspecified)

script.description: The contents of a script that will be uploaded to /usr/local/bin/civo-user-init-script on your instance, read/write/executable only by root and then will be executed at the end of the cloud initialization

size.description: The name of the size, from the current list, e.g. g3.xsmall

sshkey_id.description: The ID of an already uploaded SSH public key to use for login to the default user (optional; if one isn't provided a random password will be set and returned in the initial_password field)

tags.description: An optional list of tags, represented as a key, value pair

template.description: The ID for the template to use to build the instance

block.description: Provides a Civo instance resource. This can be used to create, modify, and delete instances.

api_endpoint.description: The API server endpoint of the cluster

applications.description: Comma separated list of applications to install. Spaces within application names are fine, but shouldn't be either side of the comma. Application names are case-sensitive; the available applications can be listed with the Civo CLI: 'civo kubernetes applications ls'. If you want to remove a default installed application, prefix it with a '-', e.g. -Traefik. For application that supports plans, you can use 'app_name:app_plan' format e.g. 'Linkerd:Linkerd & Jaeger' or 'MariaDB:5GB'.

created_at.description: The timestamp when the cluster was created

dns_entry.description: The DNS name of the cluster

firewall_id.description: The existing firewall ID to use for this cluster

kubernetes_version.description: The version of k3s to install (optional, the default is currently the latest available)

master_ip.description: The IP address of the master node

name.description: Name for your cluster, must be unique within your account

network_id.description: The network for the cluster, if not declare we use the default one

num_target_nodes.description: The number of instances to create (optional, the default at the time of writing is 3)

ready.description: When cluster is ready, this will return `true`

region.description: The region for the cluster, if not declare we use the region in declared in the provider

tags.description: Space separated list of tags, to be used freely as required

target_nodes_size.description: The size of each node (optional, the default is currently g3.k3s.medium)

block.description: Provides a Civo Kubernetes cluster resource. This can be used to create, delete, and modify clusters.

num_target_nodes.description: the number of instances to create (optional, the default at the time of writing is 3)

region.description: The region of the node pool, has to match that of the cluster

target_nodes_size.description: the size of each node (optional, the default is currently g3.k3s.medium)

block.description: Provides a Civo Kubernetes node pool resource. While the default node pool must be defined in the `civo_kubernetes_cluster` resource, this resource can be used to add additional ones to a cluster.

default.description: If the network is default, this will be `true`

block.description: Provides a Civo network resource. This can be used to create, modify, and delete networks.

fingerprint.description: a string containing the SSH finger print.

name.description: a string that will be the reference for the SSH key.

public_key.description: a string containing the SSH public key.

block.description: Provides a Civo SSH key resource to allow you to manage SSH keys for instance access. Keys created with this resource can be referenced in your instance configuration via their ID.

mount_point.description: The mount point of the volume (from instance's perspective)

name.description: A name that you wish to use to refer to this volume

network_id.description: The network that the volume belongs to

region.description: The region for the volume, if not declare we use the region in declared in the provider.

size_gb.description: A minimum of 1 and a maximum of your available disk space from your quota specifies the size of the volume in gigabytes

block.description: Provides a Civo volume which can be attached to an instance in order to provide expanded storage.

instance_id.description: The ID of target instance for attachment

region.description: The region for the volume attachment

volume_id.description: The ID of target volume for attachment

block.description: Manages volume attachment/detachment to an instance.

region.description: If is used, all disk image will be from this region. Required if no region is set in provider.

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter diskimages by this key. This may be one of `id`, `label`, `name`, `version`.

match_by.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `diskimages` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results

direction.description: The sort direction. This may be either `asc` or `desc`.

key.description: Sort diskimages by this key. This may be one of `id`, `label`, `name`, `version`.

block.description: One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results
Get information on an disk image for use in other resources (e.g. creating a instance) with the ability to filter the results.

Get information on a domain. This data source provides the name and the id.

An error will be raised if the provided domain name is not in your Civo account.

account_id.description: The ID account of the domain

created_at.description: The date when it was created in UTC format

ttl.description: How long caching DNS servers should cache this record

type.description: The choice of record type from A, CNAME, MX, SRV or TXT

updated_at.description: The date when it was updated in UTC format

value.description: The IP address (A or MX), hostname (CNAME or MX) or text value (TXT) to serve for this record

block.description:
Get information on a DNS record. This data source provides the name, TTL, and zone file as configured on your Civo account.

An error will be raised if the provided domain name or record are not in your Civo account.

created_at.description: The date of creation of the instance

firewall_id.description: The ID of the firewall used

initial_user.description: The name of the initial user created on the server

network_id.description: his will be the ID of the network

pseudo_ip.description: Is the ip that is used to route the public ip from the internet to the instance using NAT

region.description: The region of an existing Instance

script.description: The contents of a script uploaded

template.description: The ID for the disk image/template to used to build the instance

block.description:
Get information on an instance for use in other resources. This data source provides all of the instance's properties as configured on your Civo account.

Note: This data source returns a single instance. When specifying a hostname, an error will be raised if more than one instances found.

region.description: If used, all instances will be from the provided region

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter instances by this key. This may be one of `cpu_cores`, `created_at`, `disk_gb`, `firewall_id`, `hostname`, `id`, `initial_password`, `initial_user`, `network_id`, `notes`, `private_ip`, `pseudo_ip`, `public_ip`, `ram_mb`, `region`, `reverse_dns`, `script`, `size`, `sshkey_id`, `status`, `tags`, `template`.

match_by.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `instances` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results

direction.description: The sort direction. This may be either `asc` or `desc`.

key.description: Sort instances by this key. This may be one of `cpu_cores`, `created_at`, `disk_gb`, `firewall_id`, `hostname`, `id`, `initial_password`, `initial_user`, `network_id`, `notes`, `private_ip`, `pseudo_ip`, `public_ip`, `ram_mb`, `region`, `reverse_dns`, `script`, `size`, `sshkey_id`, `status`, `template`.

block.description: One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results

Get information on instances for use in other resources, with the ability to filter and sort the results. If no filters are specified, all instances will be returned.

Note: You can use the `civo_instance` data source to obtain metadata about a single instance if you already know the id, unique hostname, or unique tag to retrieve.

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter sizes by this key. This may be one of `cpu`, `description`, `disk`, `name`, `ram`, `selectable`, `type`.

match_by.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `sizes` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results

direction.description: The sort direction. This may be either `asc` or `desc`.

key.description: Sort sizes by this key. This may be one of `cpu`, `description`, `disk`, `name`, `ram`, `selectable`, `type`.

block.description: One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results
Retrieves information about the instance sizes that Civo supports, with the ability to filter the results.

api_endpoint.description: The base URL of the API server on the Kubernetes master node

created_at.description: The date where the Kubernetes cluster was create

dns_entry.description: The unique dns entry for the cluster in this case point to the master

kubeconfig.description: A representation of the Kubernetes cluster's kubeconfig in yaml format

master_ip.description: The IP of the Kubernetes master node

name.description: The name of the Kubernetes Cluster

num_target_nodes.description: The size of the Kubernetes cluster

ready.description: If the Kubernetes cluster is ready

region.description: The region where cluster is running

block.description:
Provides a Civo Kubernetes cluster data source.

Note: This data source returns a single Kubernetes cluster. When specifying a name, an error will be raised if more than one Kubernetes cluster found.

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter versions by this key. This may be one of `default`, `label`, `type`, `version`.

match_by.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `versions` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results

direction.description: The sort direction. This may be either `asc` or `desc`.

key.description: Sort versions by this key. This may be one of `default`, `label`, `type`, `version`.

block.description: One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results
Provides access to the available Civo Kubernetes versions, with the ability to filter the results.

label.description: The label of an existing network

region.description: The region of an existing network

block.description:
Retrieve information about a network for use in other resources.

This data source provides all of the network's properties as configured on your Civo account.

Networks may be looked up by id or label, and you can optionally pass region if you want to make a lookup for an expecific network inside that region.

all.description: Set to `true` to require that a field match all of the `values` instead of just one or more of them. This is useful when matching against multi-valued fields such as lists or sets where you want to ensure that all of the `values` are present in the list or set.

key.description: Filter regions by this key. This may be one of `code`, `country`, `default`, `name`.

match_by.description: One of `exact` (default), `re`, or `substring`. For string-typed fields, specify `re` to match by using the `values` as regular expressions, or specify `substring` to match by treating the `values` as substrings to find within the string field.

values.description: Only retrieves `regions` which keys has value that matches one of the values provided here

block.description: One or more key/value pairs on which to filter results

direction.description: The sort direction. This may be either `asc` or `desc`.

key.description: Sort regions by this key. This may be one of `code`, `country`, `default`, `name`.

block.description: One or more key/direction pairs on which to sort results
Retrieves information about the region that Civo supports, with the ability to filter the results.

fingerprint.description: The fingerprint of the public key of the SSH key

name.description: The name of the SSH key

block.description:
Get information on a SSH key. This data source provides the name, and fingerprint as configured on your Civo account.

An error will be raised if the provided SSH key name does not exist in your Civo account.

created_at.description: The date of the creation of the volume

mount_point.description: The mount point of the volume

region.description: The region where volume is running

size_gb.description: The size of the volume (in GB)

block.description:
Get information on a volume for use in other resources. This data source provides all of the volumes properties as configured on your Civo account.

An error will be raised if the provided volume name does not exist in your Civo account.
